channel.title: Odd port forwarding issue
channel.description:
INFO:
Source: Blankscape ISP: BT Router: Huawei Echolife-HG532 ________________________________________
OK I have a really strange port forwarding issue.
I have set up a no-ip host, forwarded ports 43594 through my router but I get the "Error connecting to server" issue when I try and log in to my private server.
I am trying to use the 'Blankscape' source and I have hosted private servers on my computer before. The only thing I can think is that my ISP has suddenly started blocking these ports?
I have ran several website based port tests and they all claim port 43594 is closed, or there is no route to host. Except for utorrents port checker, which claims the port is open and working.
Could it be the source I am using, have my ISP suddenly closed the ports? Or could there be another reason?
(I can't ring up my ISP as we are moving soon, to SKY)

item.title: Odd port forwarding issue
item.dc:creator: @abtekk abtekk
item.description:
@abtekk wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:4, topic:403943”]Never had that problem before so i googled it :d here
http://www.cyberciti.biz/tips/no-route-to-host-error-and-solution.html[/quote]

I took a few tips from there, but that was based for Debian, not Windows. :).

Read full topic

item.title: Odd port forwarding issue
item.dc:creator: @abtekk abtekk
item.description:
@abtekk wrote:

Error: I could not see your service on 81.155.230.20 on port (43594) Reason: No route to host

Read full topic

item.title: Odd port forwarding issue
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Go to canyouseeme.org and put in port 43594 and tell me what comes up.
and can other players login? if they can, use 127.0.0.1 for your client ip.

Read full topic

item.title: Odd port forwarding issue

item.description:

INFO:

Source: Blankscape
ISP: BT
Router: Huawei Echolife-HG532

OK I have a really strange port forwarding issue.

I have set up a no-ip host, forwarded ports 43594 through my router but I get the “Error connecting to server” issue when I try and log in to my private server.

I am trying to use the ‘Blankscape’ source and I have hosted private servers on my computer before. The only thing I can think is that my ISP has suddenly started blocking these ports?

I have ran several website based port tests and they all claim port 43594 is closed, or there is no route to host. Except for utorrents port checker, which claims the port is open and working.

Could it be the source I am using, have my ISP suddenly closed the ports?
